item.title: Loadmaster’s Nose Cargo Door Closed Annunciator System

numlitem.para: Nose door is visually verified closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure, and
Latches are visually verified to be fully extended before each departure.
Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Annunciator panel: "LOADMASTER’S NOSE CARGO DOOR CLOSED ANNUNCIATOR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:
Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is closed and flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
Visually check that all 16 latch pins are fully extended to a position within + 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
Accomplish all remaining normal procedures to ensure door is securely closed, latched and locked.
